thread.title: Buenos Aires named most liveable city in Latin AmericaTravelandtourworld.com
thread.title_full: Buenos Aires named most liveable city in Latin AmericaTravelandtourworld.com

author: travelandtourworld.com
title: Buenos Aires named most liveable city in Latin AmericaTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Buenos Aires named most liveable city in Latin America Published on : Thursday, August 20, 2015
Argentina’s capital Buenos Aires has been named as the most liveable city in Latin America, according to the latest global survey.
Buenos Aires was listed on top of the Economist Intelligence Unit’s annual liveability ranking for Latin America, ranking 62 out of 140 surveyed cities globally, Argentine daily Clarin reported Wednesday.
It was followed among Latin American cities by Santiago (63), Chile (64) and San Juan, Puerto Rico (67), the daily reported.
The survey looked at the liveability criteria, healthcare, education, stability, culture, environment and infrastructure.
“Latin American cities get great marks in the area of culture and environment, but not so much in stability,” the newspaper Quote: d one of the survey’s editors Jon Copestake as saying.
The newspaper credited Buenos Aires’s extensive and varied cultural offering for its high score in quality of life surveys.
Australian city Melbourne is ranked as the most liveable city in the world, followed by Austrian capital Vienna, Canada’s Vancouver and Toronto, according to the survey.
